sourceRegistry.name: Oxford Economics Yemen Macro

sourceRegistry.name: Bloomberg Terminal

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Central Statistical Office Population Projections

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Ministry of Industry & Trade

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Petroleum Company (YPC) Official Fuel Prices

sourceRegistry.name: Al Kuraimi Exchange Rate Feed

sourceRegistry.name: Saraf Online App

sourceRegistry.name: Central Bank of Yemen Sana’a Official Rate
sourceRegistry.notes: Official rate in DFA; glean from Ministry of Finance bulletins or speeches.

sourceRegistry.name: UN Commodity Trade Statistics (UNSD) for Mirror Trade
sourceRegistry.notes: Import/export of arms category; can be used to detect arms shipments (if any recorded).

sourceRegistry.name: Association of Yemeni Banks (AYB)

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Microfinance Network (YMN) Quarterly Bulletin

sourceRegistry.name: Al Kuraimi Islamic Bank Annual Reports

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Corporate Balance Sheets (Top Enterprises)

sourceRegistry.name: Money Changers (Licensed and Unlicensed) Registry

sourceRegistry.name: G7/G20 Aid Support Announcers

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Petroleum Company Fuel Subsidy Statements

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Customs Authority (if available)

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Legislation Portal (Aden & Sana’a)

sourceRegistry.name: Port of Aden & Port of Mukalla Throughput Reports

sourceRegistry.name: SAECA (Yemen Supreme Authority for Economic & Corporate Affairs)

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Customs Tariff Schedule

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Ministry of Social Affairs and Labour (MoSAL)

sourceRegistry.name: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) Data
sourceRegistry.notes:
Education indicators to populate education sub-sector panels and compare to regional benchmarks.
Where recent Yemen data is missing, keep series with explicit ‘last observed’ markers.

sourceRegistry.name: UNCTAD World Investment Report
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides trends and statistics on foreign direct investment flows; includes regional context for Yemen; supplement UNCTADstat.

sourceRegistry.name: UN Liner Shipping Connectivity Index (LSCI)
sourceRegistry.notes: Measures maritime connectivity; Yemen’s score can be used as proxy for trade facilitation and shipping disruptions.

sourceRegistry.name: UN General Assembly Resolutions & Security Council Resolutions
sourceRegistry.notes: Provide official sanction mandates, budget authorisations for UN missions; treat as legal documents; link to events.

sourceRegistry.name: UN Vehicle Registration Data (if available)
sourceRegistry.notes: May provide vehicle registrations for Yemen; relevant to transport sector.

sourceRegistry.name: UNOSAT (UNITAR) – Yemen Damage Assessments
sourceRegistry.notes:
High-quality satellite-based damage assessments; informs reconstruction cost estimates and infrastructure dashboards.
Link assessments to affected entities and locations; maintain provenance and versions.

sourceRegistry.name: UN Global SDG Indicators Database
sourceRegistry.notes: Includes SDG indicators relevant to Yemen (poverty, health, education).

sourceRegistry.name: UN SDG Global Database (Yemen indicators)
sourceRegistry.altName: قاعدة بيانات أهداف التنمية المستدامة (مؤشرات اليمن)
sourceRegistry.notes:
SDG indicators for Yemen used to populate development dashboards and provide SDG-aligned reporting exports.
Map SDG series to YETO indicators; keep metadata (goal/target/indicator) for explainers.

sourceRegistry.name: UN System of National Accounts (SNA 2008 / Updates)
sourceRegistry.publisher: UNSD / OECD / IMF / World Bank / Eurostat
sourceRegistry.notes:
Methodology baseline for GDP/GVA, sector accounts, and national accounting consistency checks across sources.
Use in Methodology/Transparency pages; cite when explaining GDP estimates, deflators, and sector contributions.

sourceRegistry.name: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides estimates of access to drinking water, sanitation, hygiene services; includes Yemen; may rely on pre‑conflict surveys; still used as baseline.

sourceRegistry.name: World Bank Global Economic Monitor (GEM)
sourceRegistry.notes: Commodities prices, remittances flows, and macro indicators used in GEM; part of WBG but requires registration.

sourceRegistry.name: ACAPS Yemen Analysis Hub (YETI)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides scenario analyses, risk bulletins and thematic briefs; narrative with contextual data; high credibility.

sourceRegistry.name: Agence Française de Développement (AFD) – projects portal
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: Al Jazeera Economy & Business (Yemen)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides Arabic‑language news on Yemen’s economy; cross‑check.

sourceRegistry.name: Arab Trade Financing Program (ATFP)
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains statistics on trade finance extended to Yemeni banks; good for understanding import finance availability.

sourceRegistry.name: Atlantic Council’s Resilience Centre
sourceRegistry.notes: Papers on Yemen’s economy, governance, and geopolitical context.

sourceRegistry.name: BBC News – Yemen Topic Page (Events only)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Secondary event detection and timeline context; enrich narrative on macro shocks and conflict milestones.
Use as supporting source; always link to primary documents where possible.

sourceRegistry.name: Bloomberg Middle East
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains financial news and commentary; subscription for full access; treat as narrative.

sourceRegistry.name: German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) – transparency/portal
sourceRegistry.altName: وزارة التعاون الاقتصادي الألمانية (BMZ) - بوابة الشفافية
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: BP Statistical Review of World Energy
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains global energy production and consumption data; includes Yemen (oil production numbers).  *Check licensing.*

sourceRegistry.name: Chatham House Middle East & North Africa programme
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides analysis on political economy, conflict drivers, humanitarian issues; narrative.

sourceRegistry.name: Rainfall Estimation from Satellite (ARC2/TRMM/GPM)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provide rainfall estimates which affect crop production and flooding; open data.

sourceRegistry.name: International Crisis Group (ICG) Reports
sourceRegistry.notes: In-depth analyses of conflict dynamics, peace initiatives, economic impacts; narrative; ingest as documents.

sourceRegistry.name: Crossref (DOI & Citation Metadata)
sourceRegistry.license: Crossref metadata license (primarily CC0 for metadata)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Normalize citations (DOI), resolve metadata, build provenance and citation graphs for Research Library and AI evidence outputs.
Use for DOI resolution and to validate references included in PDFs (reports, policy briefs, theses).

sourceRegistry.name: US Energy Information Administration (EIA) International Data
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides country energy statistics: oil production/consumption, exports, CO₂ emissions; limited for Yemen but useful for global context.

sourceRegistry.name: IMF eLibrary (Country Reports & Working Papers)
sourceRegistry.altName: مكتبة صندوق النقد الإلكترونية (تقارير وأوراق عمل)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Authoritative IMF analyses and datasets embedded in reports; used for validation and policy timeline events.
Store PDFs and extracted tables with provenance hashes.

sourceRegistry.name: Emirates Red Crescent & Other UAE Entities
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides information on aid projects in Yemen; may not be comprehensive; glean from Arabic press and FTS cross‑references.

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Desert Locust Control Programme
sourceRegistry.notes: Reports on desert locust infestations and control operations; relevant for crop yields.

sourceRegistry.name: FAO AQUASTAT (Water Resources & Irrigation)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Water resource baselines and irrigation indicators used for agriculture resilience and water stress analysis.
Data may be dated for Yemen; use as baseline and complement with remote sensing rainfall/groundwater proxies.

sourceRegistry.name: FAO AQUASTAT
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides data on water withdrawal, irrigation, and renewable water resources; may have Yemen entries; use for rural development analysis.

sourceRegistry.name: FAO GIEWS Country Briefs – Yemen
sourceRegistry.notes:
Rapid situational summaries for food security and agriculture shocks; supports timeline annotations and alerts.
Use as narrative; for quantitative series use FAOSTAT/WFP/IPC.

sourceRegistry.name: FAO Food Price Monitoring Bulletins
sourceRegistry.notes: Bulletins summarise staple food price trends across countries; includes Yemen; can complement WFP data.

sourceRegistry.name: https://finDevgateway.org FATF (Financial Action Task Force) Grey List/Mutual Evaluation
FATF (Financial Action Task Force) Grey List/Mutual Evaluation
sourceRegistry.notes: Reports on Yemen’s AML/CFT compliance; relevant for banking sector risk; narrative only.

sourceRegistry.name: FATF Recommendations (AML/CFT Standards)
sourceRegistry.altName: توصيات FATF (معايير مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Provides compliance baseline for AML/CFT risk assessment narratives; supports compliance dashboards and entity risk flags.
Use only as framework; do not label entities as illicit without evidence.

sourceRegistry.name: International Fertilizer Association (IFA)
sourceRegistry.notes: Data on fertiliser use; though Yemen-specific data may be limited; can use regional proxies.

sourceRegistry.name: FSIS (Food Security Information System) Bulletins
sourceRegistry.notes: Joint analysis by FAO/WFP/FSAC; includes food basket cost, market integration, and IPC updates.

sourceRegistry.name: Gallup World Poll (Yemen)
sourceRegistry.notes: Surveys measuring well‑being, perceptions of government, access to services; may include Yemen; subscription required.

sourceRegistry.name: GDELT Project (Global Database of Events, Language and Tone)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides automatically extracted events and tone from global media; can be filtered for Yemen; used as fallback if ACLED unavailable; treat as media‑derived and low confidence.

sourceRegistry.name: GIZ Project Database / Yemen country activities
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: KfW & GIZ Yemen programmes
sourceRegistry.notes: Lists German development and technical assistance projects in Yemen.

sourceRegistry.name: Global LEI Index (GLEIF) – Entity Identifier Cross-check
sourceRegistry.altName: فهرس LEI العالمي (GLEIF) - تحقق من معرفات الكيانات
sourceRegistry.notes:
Cross-check entity identifiers for banks, donors, and corporates with LEIs; improves entity resolution and de-duplication.
Coverage for Yemen entities may be limited; use when available to validate names and legal forms.

sourceRegistry.name: Global Hunger Index (GHI)
sourceRegistry.notes:
External validation of food insecurity trends; displayed in Food Security sector benchmarking.
Index methodology differs from IPC; show side-by-side with clear definitions.

sourceRegistry.name: FAIR Data Principles (GO FAIR)
sourceRegistry.altName: مبادئ FAIR للبيانات (قابلة للإيجاد والوصول والتشغيل وإعادة الاستخدام)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Guides data governance and metadata design for registry, provenance ledger, and API export design.
Use to justify metadata fields and persistent identifiers across sources and datasets.

sourceRegistry.name: GSMA Mobile Gender Gap Report
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains data on mobile ownership and usage by gender; proxy for access to digital labour markets; may include Yemen via modelling.

sourceRegistry.name: Payment Rail Maps (GSMA & UNCDF)
sourceRegistry.notes: Data on mobile money deployments and transaction volumes; may cover Yemen; cross‑check with mobile operators.

sourceRegistry.name: IFAD (International Fund for Agricultural Development) – Yemen portfolio
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: IFAD (International Fund for Agricultural Development) Projects
sourceRegistry.notes: Lists IFAD-funded projects (e.g., fisheries, irrigation, smallholder support); parse budgets and beneficiaries.

sourceRegistry.name: International Finance Corporation (IFC) Country Private Sector Diagnostic (CPSD)
sourceRegistry.notes: Analytical documents assessing constraints and opportunities in private sector; includes Yemen; narrative.

sourceRegistry.name: IFRS Standards (Financial Reporting / IFRS Foundation)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Defines financial statement concepts used when extracting bank/company annual reports; supports comparability and data validation.
Not all Yemen entities report under IFRS; capture the reporting basis per entity.

sourceRegistry.name: Armed Conflict Survey (IISS)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides analysis of conflict dynamics; includes Yemen; subscription required; treat as narrative.

sourceRegistry.name: ILO Regional Office Studies
sourceRegistry.notes: Reports on labour market dynamics in Arab region; may include Yemen; narrative but important context.

sourceRegistry.name: IMF Fiscal Monitor
sourceRegistry.notes: Contextual narrative on fiscal developments; includes tables of expenditure and revenue for some countries.  Ingest as documents.

sourceRegistry.name: IMF Monetary and Financial Statistics Manual & Compilation Guide (MFSMCG)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Methodology baseline for monetary aggregates, balance sheets, and financial sector indicators; helps reconcile CBY/IFS data.
Use for Banking & Finance pages, ensuring consistent definitions (M1/M2, credit, NFA).

sourceRegistry.name: IMF World Economic Outlook (WEO)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides macro forecasts for GDP growth, inflation, fiscal balance; also baseline and scenario projections.

sourceRegistry.name: IMF Data Quality Assessment Framework (DQAF)
sourceRegistry.altName: إطار تقييم جودة البيانات (DQAF) - صندوق النقد
sourceRegistry.notes:
Defines data quality dimensions used in YETO’s confidence engine (integrity, methodological soundness, accuracy, serviceability).
Map DQAF dimensions to YETO’s A/B/C/D scoring rubric and transparency tooltips.

sourceRegistry.name: IMF Balance of Payments and IIP Manual (BPM6)
sourceRegistry.altName: دليل ميزان المدفوعات ومركز الاستثمار الدولي (BPM6)
sourceRegistry.notes:
External-sector methodology baseline: trade, transfers, remittances, reserves; guides cross-source consistency checks.
Use in Methodology and external sector dashboards; align terminology and identities (CA + KA + FA).

sourceRegistry.name: IMF Government Finance Statistics Manual (GFSM 2014)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Methodology baseline for fiscal classification, revenue/expenditure mapping, and budget execution analytics.
Use for mapping Yemen budget lines (pre-2015 BOOST/CSO) and for structuring nowcasted public finance estimates.

sourceRegistry.name: Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) Analysis
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides classification of food insecurity phases per governorate; narrative and maps; ingest for context.

sourceRegistry.name: Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) Project Data
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains approved and active projects in Yemen; extract funding amounts and sectors; licensing open.

sourceRegistry.name: INTOSAI – ISSAI (International Standards of Supreme Audit Institutions)
sourceRegistry.altName: إنتوساي - معايير الأجهزة العليا للرقابة المالية (ISSAI)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Reference standards for audit methodology; underpins Transparency & Accountability page and how YETO evaluates published audit reports.
Use to define what ‘audited’ means in source confidence scoring and audit report extraction.

sourceRegistry.name: International Telecommunication Union (ITU) ICT Indicators
sourceRegistry.notes:
Connectivity indicators supporting ICT sector pages, digital economy analysis, and service access dashboards.
Triangulate with telecom operator annual reports and humanitarian connectivity assessments.

sourceRegistry.name: Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) Yemen
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains small projects (health, water); parse details.

sourceRegistry.name: Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) – Yemen country page
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: KfW Development Bank – projects and evaluations
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre (KSrelief) Project Database
sourceRegistry.notes: Lists aid projects financed by Saudi Arabia; includes budgets and sectors; incorporate for donor profiles.

sourceRegistry.name: Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development – projects database
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: MENAFATF – AML/CFT Mutual Evaluation & Typologies (Yemen relevant)
sourceRegistry.altName: MENAFATF - تقارير وتقييمات مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب
sourceRegistry.notes:
Contextual AML/CFT compliance risks; supports illicit finance risk notes and compliance tooltips in Banking & Finance pages.
Use for narrative risk overlays; do not infer illicit activity without direct evidence.

sourceRegistry.name: Middle East Eye & Yemen Press
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides investigative reports and commentary; narrative; cross‑check.

sourceRegistry.name: UAE Ministry of Foreign Affairs – International Cooperation / Yemen assistance pages
sourceRegistry.altName: وزارة الخارجية الإماراتية - التعاون الدولي/مساعدات اليمن
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: Natural Earth (Basemap and Geo Boundaries)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Basemap layers for maps and infographics; supports admin map rendering and offline fallback.
Not used for Yemen admin COD; only for generalized basemap layers.

sourceRegistry.name: NOAA Integrated Surface Database (ISD)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides weather observations (temperature, precipitation) from local stations; Yemen coverage may be limited; use for climate context.

sourceRegistry.name: Norad – Aid results and statistics (Yemen queries)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: OpenStreetMap (OSM) – Yemen POIs and Infrastructure (with caution)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Supplementary POI and infrastructure layers (roads, facilities) for mapping; helpful for logistics context.
Crowdsourced; verify critical facilities with UN datasets; do not use for sensitive locations.

sourceRegistry.name: Oxford Institute for Energy Studies
sourceRegistry.notes: Papers on oil and gas markets; may include Yemen; narrative.

sourceRegistry.name: Qatar Fund for Development (QFFD) – Yemen
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: Qatar Charity & Qatar Development Fund
sourceRegistry.notes: Aid programmes in Yemen; parse available information; treat with caution.

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Infrastructure Damage Database (UNDAC/REACH)
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains geolocated points of infrastructure damage (bridges, hospitals, schools) collected via satellite and field surveys.  Ingest as geospatial layer.

sourceRegistry.name: Reuters Yemen Economic News
sourceRegistry.notes: For narrative updates on oil exports, currency, port operations; treat as information; cross‑verify.

sourceRegistry.name: Saba News Agency (Aden & Sana’a)
sourceRegistry.notes: Official news from both governments; use for announcements of policies, fuel price changes, etc.; treat with caution.

sourceRegistry.name: Saudi Development and Reconstruction Program for Yemen (SDRPY)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

sourceRegistry.name: Semantic Scholar (Research Search & Metadata)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Secondary academic discovery and de-duplication; enrich metadata (topics, authors, citations) for Yemen-focused research.
Use as supplemental discovery; prioritize OpenAlex/Crossref for canonical metadata.

sourceRegistry.name: SSRN (Social Science Research Network) – Yemen/Economics Queries
sourceRegistry.notes:
Supplemental source for working papers and early research on Yemen conflict-economy, aid effectiveness, and macro stabilization.
Use as discovery only; validate claims via primary sources.

sourceRegistry.name: Global Terrorism Database (GTD)
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains incidents of terrorism worldwide; includes events in Yemen; may help contextualise conflict intensity.

sourceRegistry.name: ICE Brent Crude Price
sourceRegistry.notes: International benchmark oil price; necessary for scenario modeling; license required for real‑time feed; use public index if available.

sourceRegistry.name: International Trade Centre (ITC) Trade Map
sourceRegistry.notes:
Trade patterns and mirror statistics; complements UN Comtrade and DOTS with practical trade intelligence tools.
Some content may require registration; treat as secondary to UN Comtrade.

sourceRegistry.name: Transparency International Corruption Perceptions Index
sourceRegistry.notes: Global ranking of corruption perceptions; includes Yemen; used to benchmark governance environment.

sourceRegistry.name: United Nations Panel of Experts on Yemen Reports
sourceRegistry.notes: Investigates implementation of sanctions, arms embargo violations, illicit finance; includes detailed annexes.  Ingest as documents (sensitive).

sourceRegistry.name: UNDP Yemen Economic Resilience & Livelihoods Studies
sourceRegistry.notes: Reports on cash-for-work programmes, livelihood outcomes; may include small datasets on job creation.

sourceRegistry.name: UN DP Partnership for Renewable Energy in Yemen
sourceRegistry.notes: Documents renewable energy projects (solar micro‑grids); includes installation numbers and beneficiaries; parse for impact metrics.

sourceRegistry.name: UNFPA Data Portal
sourceRegistry.altName: بوابة بيانات صندوق الأمم المتحدة للسكان (UNFPA)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Demographic structure and reproductive health indicators; supports human development dashboards and gender analysis.
Use to triangulate with UN Population Division and Yemen survey data when available.

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen Port Authority & UNVIM Import Reports
sourceRegistry.notes: Data on fuel and food shipments through Hodeidah, Salif and Ras Isa ports; used as trade and supply proxies.

sourceRegistry.name: USAID (US Agency for International Development) Assistance
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains press releases and project summaries; budget info may be limited; complement IATI.

sourceRegistry.name: USAspending.gov (Yemen-related aid queries)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Validate US funding flows and contracts/grants; connect to implementers, sectors, and locations where available.
Use as cross-check against USAID fact sheets and IATI where published.

sourceRegistry.name: V-Dem (Varieties of Democracy) Dataset
sourceRegistry.notes:
Governance/institution indicators to enrich governance timelines and long-run institutional deterioration analysis.
Use as supplementary context; do not treat as official statistics.

sourceRegistry.name: WCAG 2.2 (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Accessibility baseline for YETO UI components (charts, dashboards, tables) across EN/AR; ensures inclusive design.
Apply to all new pages; include in QA checklist.

sourceRegistry.name: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Baseline health indicators for Yemen and comparators; complements cluster reporting for conflict years.
Label the reporting year and data provenance; do not mix modeled and reported without marking.

sourceRegistry.name: World Bank Yemen Economic Monitor
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides narrative and data on macroeconomic developments; official WBG perspective.

sourceRegistry.name: World Bank Enterprise Finance Gap Database
sourceRegistry.notes: Estimates financing gaps for SMEs; includes Yemen; can supplement microfinance data.

sourceRegistry.name: World Bank Global Findex Database
sourceRegistry.notes:
Financial inclusion benchmarking; informs Banking & Finance sector and inclusion indicators.
Triangulate with local microfinance network data and any CBY/AMF inclusion metrics.

sourceRegistry.name: World Bank Commodity Markets (Pink Sheet)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Global commodity price baselines used to model import costs, inflation pass-through, and oil revenue scenarios.
Use as exogenous drivers in scenario simulator.

sourceRegistry.name: World Bank’s Fragility, Conflict & Violence (FCV) Newsletter
sourceRegistry.notes: Updates on FCV research; includes Yemen case studies; narrative.

sourceRegistry.name: WorldPop (High-resolution Population Estimates)
sourceRegistry.notes:
Subnational population grids for mapping indicators and estimating affected populations when admin-pop baselines are outdated.
Use with HDX COD admin boundaries; document uncertainties and versions.

sourceRegistry.name: World Trade Organization (WTO) Tariff Database
sourceRegistry.notes: Contains applied and bound tariffs; Yemen not WTO member but data may exist via Gulf Cooperation Council; treat as context.

sourceRegistry.name: Yemen General Investment Authority (YGIA)
sourceRegistry.notes: Provides investment promotion materials and data on licensed investment projects; seldom updated; treat with caution.

sourceRegistry.name: UNFPA Youth & NEET Studies
sourceRegistry.notes: Studies on youth not in employment, education or training (NEET), and demographic dividends.

config.notes: Provides national and governorate population estimates; used by UN agencies.  Tag regime accordingly.
May release official commodity price lists or inflation updates; scarce due to conflict.  Ingest if available.
Announced by Ministry of Oil or other agencies; used to set official prices in IRG-controlled areas.
An app used by Yemeni traders posting parallel market rates; data may be accessible via API or manual capture; mark as low confidence.
Official rate in DFA; glean from Ministry of Finance bulletins or speeches.
Import/export of arms category; can be used to detect arms shipments (if any recorded).
Provide financial statements (assets, deposits, profit) and branch network; parse for insights; may contain credit risk indicators.
Government and multilateral pledges for Yemen; capture announcements (e.g. Saudi Arabia, UAE, USA).
Announcements on subsidy adjustments; feed into subsidy tracker.
May contain customs collection figures; scarce; treat as low confidence.
Collects public finance laws, budgets, tax decrees; vital for legal library.
Data on container and cargo volumes handled by southern ports; glean from port authority websites or local media.
DP World manages Aden port; reports may contain Yemen trade throughput; treat as secondary.
Document lists of authorised importers/exporters; may help track commodity flows; scarce.
If revived, may publish commercial regulations; currently dormant.  Placeholder for future.
Contains lists of applied tariffs by HS code; needed for trade policy analysis; may be outdated.
Data on oil output, refinery operations, revenue sharing between Aden and Sana’a; highly politicised; glean via news.
Provide estimates of fuel demand; cross‑check with WFP fuel price bulletins.
Announces LPG cylinder prices and distribution schedules; important for cost of living analysis.
May provide information on minimum wage, labour regulations; seldom published; glean via local media.
Pre‑2013 official data; update for proxies if available.
Provide production volumes by crop, area cultivated; mostly outdated; treat as historical baseline.
Last survey pre‑2014; should be added if new rounds conducted post‑conflict; treat as potential.
Provide number of Yemeni refugees abroad and refugees in Yemen.
Provide counts of internally displaced persons, returnees, and migrant arrivals by governorate.
Import/export of arms category; can be used to detect arms shipments (if any recorded).
Provide names of individuals/entities under sanctions; see master registry.
Provide names of Yemeni entities under US sanctions.
Provide names under EU/UK sanctions regimes.
Provide casualty reports and conflict updates; seldom reliable; treat as narrative.
Provide counts of airstrikes and civilian casualties; high credibility.
Provide information on subscriber numbers, network coverage, restoration of services; glean via press releases.
Provide updates on electricity supply, power plant repairs, load shedding; glean from local news; treat as narrative.
Provide updates on cross‑border investments by Gulf and Yemeni expatriates; glean from media or business associations.
Could provide data on non‑oil exports, SME exporters; currently inactive; placeholder.
See above.
Already in master registry; keep.
China-financed development projects; may involve ports/energy; gather announcements.
Coverage on Yemen’s business and economy; narrative; cross‑verify.
Provides dust storm forecasts and air quality metrics (PM10, PM2.5) which can impact livelihoods and health; integrate if relevant.
Large database of development finance; includes some Yemen projects with geolocation; can augment IATI/FTS; registration required.
Aggregated macro statistics for Arab countries; may provide monetary aggregates and inflation proxies.  *Check licensing.*
Aggregates official and market data (CPI, FX, interest rates).  Free tier requires registration; verify data provenance.  *Check licensing.*
Provides market price data for food and fuel commodities.  Not all countries have API; check for Yemen.
External debt stocks and debt service flows.
Provides poverty headcount ratios (US$1.90, US$3.20, US$5.50 lines) and income distribution data.  Tag as “World Bank – PovcalNet”.
Already included; emphasise infrastructure subsector tags.
Already in master registry; includes project titles, funding, status; integrate fully.
Provides global cereals supply/demand and price outlook; used for context on import costs.
Commodity production, consumption and trade balances by country; includes Yemen for selected crops; check coverage.
Provides indicators on access to finance, account penetration, digital payments.
Contains data on transfers of major weapons systems, including arms flows to parties in Yemen; informs sanctions/compliance modules.
Provides detailed crude oil production by member countries; Yemen not a member but regionally relevant; can cross‑check supply.
Research papers on rent-seeking, wartime economies; includes Yemen case studies; narrative.
Contains government expenditure and revenue data by sector for some countries; check if Yemen pre‑2014 data exists.
Analytical articles; narrative.

Track Yemen Humanitarian Fund allocations, partners, project locations, and sector breakdown; integrate with project maps.
Use as granular pooled-fund layer; connect grantees to entity profiles.

Climate and hazard baselines (rainfall, temperature) to contextualize agriculture output shocks and disaster impacts.
Use derived indicators (SPI, drought indices) with transparent methodology.

Track CERF allocations and timelines; link allocations to sectors, implementing agencies, and geographic targeting.
Cross-check with FTS/IATI for overlaps and transaction details.
Provides funding allocations by sector; cross‑check with FTS; ingest as documents.
Official statistical yearbooks covering GDP by sector, CPI, population, education, health (up to 2014).  Ingest scanned PDFs; extract tables via OCR.  Coverage ends before conflict.
Lists humanitarian projects by organisation, cluster, geography; includes output metrics; integrate into geospatial viewer.

Primary gateway for IMF datasets (WEO/IFS/DOTS/GFS); anchor references for YETO ingestion connectors.
Use dataset-specific links for connectors; keep this as umbrella reference.

Alternative commodity price series for scenario inputs and validation of oil/fuel benchmarks.
Use alongside World Bank Pink Sheet and ICE Brent depending on availability.

Trade partner flows (mirror data) used to backfill Yemen trade series when national reporting is missing.
Label as mirror/trade partner reporting where applicable.

Fiscal aggregates and historical series, used for baseline and cross-checks with pre-2015 Yemen budget data.
Expect gaps for Yemen post-2015; document missingness and use proxies.
Socio-economic indicators for MENA; includes GDP, inflation, unemployment, energy.  API or bulk download available; license open with attribution.

Country-level and thematic indicators feeding poverty/human development dashboards and sector explainers.
Use as secondary to cluster operational data for in-crisis periods; cite metadata and definitions.
Lists UNOPS projects (roads, bridges, water systems) with budgets and completion status; vital for infrastructure module.
Includes indicators on gender equality, women’s participation; limited for Yemen but informative.
Contains wages/earnings but limited for Yemen; still note as potential source.

Trade policy context and available tariff/NTM indicators; supports trade environment benchmarking and explainers.
Yemen coverage may be limited; use primarily for policy context and comparators.
Joint initiative producing policy briefs on banking, fuel subsidies, private sector; narrative.

Bilateral donor project registry; use to backfill projects not fully represented in IATI and validate amounts/timelines.
Prefer IATI as canonical transactions; use DevTracker for narrative and program context.
Shows IFC investments and advisory services in Yemen; extract investment amounts, dates, sectors.
Provides labour force statistics, unemployment rates, wages, and structural unemployment analysis; baseline before conflict.
Provide shapefiles of roads, bridges, schools, health facilities; used for mapping infrastructure damage and coverage; license: ODbL (open).
SEMC publishes price bulletins for staples (flour, fuel, gas) in Yemen’s main cities.  Integrate via PDF scraping.
Reports on school availability, enrolment, gender parity, infrastructure damage; includes small datasets.
Survey microdata on firm characteristics, performance, business environment; requires registration.
Provides VIIRS night‑time lights composites aggregated by country or custom shape; used as economic proxy.  *Open data.*
Scholarly papers on trade and commerce in the Middle East; some on Yemen; ingest for narrative context.
Famine Early Warning Systems Network provides market price bulletins and integrated food security outlooks; includes Yemen; open data.
Reports and datasets on microfinance; search for Yemen; cross‑reference with YMN.

Proxy signals for fires and explosions; supports event detection overlays and infrastructure risk monitoring.
Use as proxy only; corroborate with other sources and conflict datasets.

Cross-check WFP market monitor and provide additional price series and analysis for Yemen and comparators.
Use primarily as triangulation; highlight methodological differences.

Composite fragility index used as contextual risk overlay; supports risk dashboards and scenario weighting.
Use as context only; triangulate with UCDP/ACLED and economic indicators.
Provides ranking of secrecy jurisdictions; Yemen may be included; used for context.
Provides health expenditure per capita, out‑of‑pocket spending, and health system indicators.  Use as proxy for cost of health.
Provides raster data on built‑up areas and population density; allows urban/rural comparisons.

Gender inclusion benchmark; supports inclusive recovery narratives and gender indicators context.
Use as contextual benchmark; pair with UN Women/UNFPA reports for Yemen-specific depth.
Provides solar irradiation data; used for renewable energy investment planning; open data.
Includes HDI, GII, and Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) for Yemen.  Ingest for context.
Reports on intra‑OIC trade; may include Yemen’s trade ties with Islamic countries.

Identify Yemen-related working papers and preprints (IMF/WB/academia). Feed scenario modeling assumptions and evidence citations.
Configure periodic keyword/country queries; store links + metadata; fetch PDFs when license permits.

Benchmark governance dimensions (political stability, effectiveness, rule of law) to contextualize economic outcomes and risk.
Used for cross-country comparison; not a direct metric of Yemen’s GDP, but a governance context indicator.
Provides microdata on household energy use from previous censuses; Yemen 2004 census microdata available; useful for baseline energy access.
Reports on Yemen’s budget process and transparency; narrative.
Scores budget transparency, participation and oversight; Yemen scored 0 in recent years.
Updates on road closures, damaged bridges, and alternate routes; ingest into timeline and map overlays.
Provide NDVI/EVI values; used to track agricultural productivity and drought; aggregated to governorate level; open data.
Ranking of countries’ logistics performance; Yemen historically scored low; use as context.
Conducted to measure COVID‑19 impact on households; includes employment, income, food security; microdata available upon request.
Household surveys capturing nutrition, child health, and some expenditure data.  Yemen’s last MICS in 2006; still useful for baseline.

Project-level transparency for UNDP portfolios; integrates into project registry and donor/implementer profiles.
Use as implementer-side confirmation of project status and outputs.

Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.

Discover new peer-reviewed papers, working papers, and institutional outputs related to Yemen economy (2010–present). Seed and continuously refresh Research Library and Evidence Engine.
Use OpenAlex queries by concepts (Yemen, conflict, macro, inflation, aid), affiliations, and keywords in EN/AR. Store metadata only; fetch full text from publisher links where allowed.

Secondary cross-check for entity existence, aliases, and linked officers where available; supports entity resolution.
Not a replacement for official Yemen registries; label clearly as secondary/aggregated.
Ease-of-doing-business rankings, cost of starting a business, etc.  Useful for private sector context.
Detailed dataset of WFP’s operations, budgets, beneficiaries, and outputs; API available; cross‑link with Aid Tracker.

Security checklist for YETO platform (admin panels, APIs, subscriptions, user data).
Integrate into platform QA gates and audit logs; document on Transparency page (security posture without sensitive details).

Poverty headcounts/inequality estimates (where available), baselines for poverty dashboards and scenario modeling.
Use as the default poverty platform (successor to PovcalNet); maintain versioning when methodology updates.
Standard demographic projections; includes fertility, mortality, migration.  Use for cross‑checking CSO and UNFPA projections.
Summarises people in need by sector and governorate; includes severity scores; narrative and some numeric tables; extract into data points.
Produces policy papers, economic briefs and weekly updates; narrative; widely used by analysts.
Analytical papers on the banking sector, bank splits, liquidity; ingest as documents.
Provides country‑pair trade flows used to infer FX positions; complement Comtrade.
Provides data and case studies on war economies; may include Yemen; useful for context.
Measures soil moisture; can signal drought conditions; aggregated to region; open data.
Provides data on global currency trading, including USD/YER turnover if reported; low coverage; useful for context.
Donor funding by sector/project; includes aid flows to Yemen not captured in FTS.

Education indicators to populate education sub-sector panels and compare to regional benchmarks.
Where recent Yemen data is missing, keep series with explicit ‘last observed’ markers.
Provides trends and statistics on foreign direct investment flows; includes regional context for Yemen; supplement UNCTADstat.
Measures maritime connectivity; Yemen’s score can be used as proxy for trade facilitation and shipping disruptions.
Provide official sanction mandates, budget authorisations for UN missions; treat as legal documents; link to events.
May provide vehicle registrations for Yemen; relevant to transport sector.

High-quality satellite-based damage assessments; informs reconstruction cost estimates and infrastructure dashboards.
Link assessments to affected entities and locations; maintain provenance and versions.
Includes SDG indicators relevant to Yemen (poverty, health, education).

SDG indicators for Yemen used to populate development dashboards and provide SDG-aligned reporting exports.
Map SDG series to YETO indicators; keep metadata (goal/target/indicator) for explainers.

Methodology baseline for GDP/GVA, sector accounts, and national accounting consistency checks across sources.
Use in Methodology/Transparency pages; cite when explaining GDP estimates, deflators, and sector contributions.
Provides estimates of access to drinking water, sanitation, hygiene services; includes Yemen; may rely on pre‑conflict surveys; still used as baseline.
Commodities prices, remittances flows, and macro indicators used in GEM; part of WBG but requires registration.
Provides scenario analyses, risk bulletins and thematic briefs; narrative with contextual data; high credibility.

Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.
Provides Arabic‑language news on Yemen’s economy; cross‑check.
Contains statistics on trade finance extended to Yemeni banks; good for understanding import finance availability.
Papers on Yemen’s economy, governance, and geopolitical context.

Secondary event detection and timeline context; enrich narrative on macro shocks and conflict milestones.
Use as supporting source; always link to primary documents where possible.
Contains financial news and commentary; subscription for full access; treat as narrative.

Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.
Contains global energy production and consumption data; includes Yemen (oil production numbers).  *Check licensing.*
Provides analysis on political economy, conflict drivers, humanitarian issues; narrative.
Provide rainfall estimates which affect crop production and flooding; open data.
In-depth analyses of conflict dynamics, peace initiatives, economic impacts; narrative; ingest as documents.

Normalize citations (DOI), resolve metadata, build provenance and citation graphs for Research Library and AI evidence outputs.
Use for DOI resolution and to validate references included in PDFs (reports, policy briefs, theses).
Provides country energy statistics: oil production/consumption, exports, CO₂ emissions; limited for Yemen but useful for global context.

Authoritative IMF analyses and datasets embedded in reports; used for validation and policy timeline events.
Store PDFs and extracted tables with provenance hashes.
Provides information on aid projects in Yemen; may not be comprehensive; glean from Arabic press and FTS cross‑references.
Reports on desert locust infestations and control operations; relevant for crop yields.

Water resource baselines and irrigation indicators used for agriculture resilience and water stress analysis.
Data may be dated for Yemen; use as baseline and complement with remote sensing rainfall/groundwater proxies.
Provides data on water withdrawal, irrigation, and renewable water resources; may have Yemen entries; use for rural development analysis.

Rapid situational summaries for food security and agriculture shocks; supports timeline annotations and alerts.
Use as narrative; for quantitative series use FAOSTAT/WFP/IPC.
Bulletins summarise staple food price trends across countries; includes Yemen; can complement WFP data.
Reports on Yemen’s AML/CFT compliance; relevant for banking sector risk; narrative only.

Provides compliance baseline for AML/CFT risk assessment narratives; supports compliance dashboards and entity risk flags.
Use only as framework; do not label entities as illicit without evidence.
Data on fertiliser use; though Yemen-specific data may be limited; can use regional proxies.
Joint analysis by FAO/WFP/FSAC; includes food basket cost, market integration, and IPC updates.
Surveys measuring well‑being, perceptions of government, access to services; may include Yemen; subscription required.
Provides automatically extracted events and tone from global media; can be filtered for Yemen; used as fallback if ACLED unavailable; treat as media‑derived and low confidence.

Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.
Lists German development and technical assistance projects in Yemen.

Cross-check entity identifiers for banks, donors, and corporates with LEIs; improves entity resolution and de-duplication.
Coverage for Yemen entities may be limited; use when available to validate names and legal forms.

External validation of food insecurity trends; displayed in Food Security sector benchmarking.
Index methodology differs from IPC; show side-by-side with clear definitions.

Guides data governance and metadata design for registry, provenance ledger, and API export design.
Use to justify metadata fields and persistent identifiers across sources and datasets.
Contains data on mobile ownership and usage by gender; proxy for access to digital labour markets; may include Yemen via modelling.
Data on mobile money deployments and transaction volumes; may cover Yemen; cross‑check with mobile operators.

Capture donor/implementer portfolios, press releases, and project details that may be missing from IATI/FTS.
Treat as official donor narrative; cross-check financial figures with IATI/FTS/OECD CRS when possible.
Lists IFAD-funded projects (e.g., fisheries, irrigation, smallholder support); parse budgets and beneficiaries.
Analytical documents assessing constraints and opportunities in private sector; includes Yemen; narrative.

Defines financial statement concepts used when extracting bank/company annual reports; supports comparability and data validation.
Not all Yemen entities report under IFRS; capture the reporting basis per entity.
Provides analysis of conflict dynamics; includes Yemen; subscription required; treat as narrative.
Reports on labour market dynamics in Arab region; may include Yemen; narrative but important context.
Contextual narrative on fiscal developments; includes tables of expenditure and revenue for some countries.  Ingest as documents.
